name: Clin N NET Colon
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 2:**  Inferior mesenteric nodes are coded in distant metastasis for cecum, ascending colon, transverse colon, and hepatic flexure. Superior mesenteric nodes are coded in distant metastasis for all colon sites.

** Note 3:** Regional lymph nodes for colon
 
**All colon sites** 

    Colic [NOS] 
    Epicolic (adjacent to bowel wall) 
    Mesocolic [NOS] 
    Mesenteric [NOS]
    Paracolic/pericolic

**Cecum (C180)** 

    Anterior (prececal), 
    Cecal [NOS]
    Ileocolic
    Periappendiceal
    Posterior (retrocecal)
    Right colic 

**Ascending colon (C182)** 

    Ileocolic
    Middle colic
    Right colic

**Hepatic flexure (C183)** 

    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Transverse colon (C184)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Splenic flexure (C185)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic

**Descending colon (C186)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Sigmoid 

**Sigmoid colon (C187)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Rectosigmoid 
    Sigmoid 
    Sigmoidal (sigmoid mesenteric) 
    Superior hemorrhoidal 
    Superior rectal
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
